intro: Phaseolus sphaericus var. bipunctatus, commonly known as the two-spotted scarlet runner bean, is a unique variety of legume native to South America. It is characterized by its distinctive red and white striped pods and round, edible seeds. The plant typically grows as a climbing vine, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are heart-shaped with a slightly hairy texture, and it thrives in warm, sunny climates with well-drained soil. This variety is prized for its ornamental value and is also cultivated for its flavorful beans.
